content:
• Thursday, June 20, 2013
  • CDTI

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI) says it's completed a strategic review of its business and...

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI) says it's completed a strategic review of its business and determined to that it will pursue the development of its materials science platform. In connection with the review, the company plans to pursue additional licensing and partnership arrangements to accelerate the commercialization of its materials technology and reduce its need for additional capital expenditures to expand its manufacturing platform. Shares -5.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM
  • ORCL

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) guides on its FQ4 call for FQ1 revenue growth of 2%-5% and constant currency...

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) guides on its FQ4 call for FQ1 revenue growth of 2%-5% and constant currency EPS of $0.56-$0.59; that compares with a consensus of 4.5% rev. growth and non-constant-currency EPS of $0.58. Software license/cloud subscription rev. growth is forecast at -1% to +7%, and hardware product growth at -6% to +2%; the latter is much better than FQ4's -13%, but aided by easier comps. Engineered systems now make up over 1/3 of hardware sales. Mark Hurd names dozens of major cloud customer wins, and claims Oracle's cloud HR business is bigger than Workday's (NYSE:WDAY). But what does that say about traditional software sales, in light of the total license numbers? ORCL -8% AH. SAP -1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • WMC

    Western Asset Mortgage (NYSE:WMC) gains 3.2% AH (it fell 4.8% in the regular session) after...

    Western Asset Mortgage (NYSE:WMC) gains 3.2% AH (it fell 4.8% in the regular session) after cutting its quarterly dividend 5.2% to $0.90/share - an annualized yield of 20.8% - and estimating book value as of May 31 of $19.25/share. At today's $17.28 close, the stock is trading at a 10.2% discount to book. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • SBGL

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SBGL +5%. RES +4%. CVI +3%. DLR +3%. IWM +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SBGL +5%. RES +4%. CVI +3%. DLR +3%. IWM +3%.
    After-hours top losers: IDIX -30%. ORCL -9%. MCP -3%. WLT -2%. AKS -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • FDML

    Federal-Mogul (NASDAQ:FDML) says that due to volatile market conditions, it's defering its...

    Federal-Mogul (NASDAQ:FDML) says that due to volatile market conditions, it's defering its refinancing activities. In addition, the company has extended the expiration date of its rights offering to July 1, and will permit rights holders to elect to withdraw the exercise of any previously exercised subscription rights. Shares +1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) -2.2% AH after Standard & Poor's places all existing ratings...

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) -2.2% AH after Standard & Poor's places all existing ratings on the company, including the B corporate credit rating, on CreditWatch with negative implications. Last week, WLT decided not to proceed with its proposed refinancing, but the ratings firm says the transaction would have pushed out maturities and eliminated maintenance covenants, improving its liquidity position.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • SVNTQ

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SVNT) announces the formation of an Office of the President,...

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SVNT) announces the formation of an Office of the President, consisting of Richard Crowley, who will serve as Co-President and COO, John P. Hamill, who will serve as Co-President and CFO, and Philip K. Yachmetz, who will serve as Co-President and Chief Business Officer. Savient also says that Louis Ferrari, President, CEO, and Director, is leaving the Company to pursue other interests, effective immediately. Shares -4.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • IBM

    More on Oracle:  New software license/cloud subscription growth only 1% Y/Y in FQ4 (was -2%...

    More on Oracle:  New software license/cloud subscription growth only 1% Y/Y in FQ4 (was -2% in FQ3 and +17% in FQ2), at low end of guidance of 1%-11% (cloud competition to blame?). Software license/product support sales +6% (+7% prior), hardware product sales -13% (-23% prior), at high end of guidance of -13% to -23%. Engineered systems sales +45%, Oracle claims share gains against IBM's System p line. ERP/HR/CRM cloud app sales +50% Y/Y, total cloud business on $1B/year run rate. $2.8B spent on buybacks, limiting EPS miss. Company moving to NYSE. ORCL -6.3% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast), guidance should be provided. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • ORCL

    Oracle Corporation (NYSE:ORCL) declares $0.12/share quarterly dividend, 100% increase from prior...

    Oracle Corporation (NYSE:ORCL) declares $0.12/share quarterly dividend, 100% increase from prior dividend of $0.06. Forward yield 1.46%. For shareholders of record July 12. Payable Aug. 02. Ex-div date July 10. Shares -4.9% AH. The board authorized to repurchase additional $12.0B of common stock. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • TMUS

    T-Mobile USA (TMUS +3.1%) jumps after Sprint raises its offer for Clearwire to $5/share, thereby...

    T-Mobile USA (TMUS +3.1%) jumps after Sprint raises its offer for Clearwire to $5/share, thereby trumping Dish's $4.40/share tender offer. The #4 U.S. carrier has been talking with Sprint merger partner SoftBank and is viewed by many as a backup option for both SoftBank and Dish. This morning, Goldman declared T-Mobile "could offer the last chance for a new entrant looking to control a nationwide wireless network."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • RIO

    Rio Tinto (RIO -4.3%) will postpone an initial copper concentrate shipment from the Oyu Tolgoi...

    Rio Tinto (RIO -4.3%) will postpone an initial copper concentrate shipment from the Oyu Tolgoi mining project planned for tomorrow at the request of the Mongolian government. At issue appears to be a Mongolian demand for sales revenues from the mine to be deposited in the country, FT reports; there's also a presidential election next week, and the mine's role in the economy has been an election issue. TRQ -6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 11 Comments
  • AGNC

    Mortgage-backed securities continue their tumble, the yield on Fannie Mae issuance up another 8...

    Mortgage-backed securities continue their tumble, the yield on Fannie Mae issuance up another 8 bps to a 20-month high of 3.29%. The "violent" reaction to the "moderate" shift in Fed message proves the market was "all-in" says TCW's Bryan Whalen. The slide in MBS prices eventually might make for great opportunities for mREITs (REM -3.9%), but for now book values may continue to deteriorate. American Capital (AGNC -4.8%), MTGE>>, Armour (ARR -3.9%), Invesco (IVR -4.4%), New York Mortgage (NYMT -5.1%), Apollo (AMTG -4.8%), Javelin (JMI -4.7%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 12 Comments
  • PLX

    Protalix BioTherapeutics (PLX -3.3%) discloses new data regarding three new compounds in...

    Protalix BioTherapeutics (PLX -3.3%) discloses new data regarding three new compounds in development, oral PRX-106 for immune mediated disorders, PRX-110 for Cystic Fibrosis, and PRX-107 for emphysema from heredity alpha1-antitrypsin deficiency. The compounds are based off its plant-cell based platform, ProCellEx, which has the capacity to generate a diverse array of protein therapeutics.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • PQ

    Investors are leery of Petroquest's (PQ -10%) purchase of shallow water properties in the Gulf...

    Investors are leery of Petroquest's (PQ -10%) purchase of shallow water properties in the Gulf of Mexico for $193M because the recent industry preference is to move onshore, where drilling risks and liabilities are lower, a Sterne Agee analyst says. But he believes the acquisition is "transformative" and will dramatically increase PQ's cash flow in 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +6.8%) resumes trading following its halt. Shares are at $5.02, slightly above...

    Clearwire (CLWR +6.8%) resumes trading following its halt. Shares are at $5.02, slightly above Sprint's new $5/share offer price.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • ALNY

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY -5.2%) presents new pre-clinical data on ALN-CC5, an RNAi...

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY -5.2%) presents new pre-clinical data on ALN-CC5, an RNAi therapeutic targeting complement component C5 for the treatment of complement-mediated diseases. The data showed the inhibition of complement-mediated hemolytic activity of approximately 90% with a subcutaneously administered RNAi therapeutic. The company believes that the data shows encouraging results, and it expects to nominate a development candidate for clinical advancement in late 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • S

    Sprint (S +0.6%) raises its offer for Clearwire (CLWR +1.7%) to $5/share, well above Dish's...

    Sprint (S +0.6%) raises its offer for Clearwire (CLWR +1.7%) to $5/share, well above Dish's (DISH -2%) $4.40/share tender offer. Clearwire's special committee is endorsing the offer (reversing its prior recommendation for Dish's bid), and is rescheduling a shareholder vote set for June 24 to July 8. Clearwire shares are halted; Dish's have spiked lower. Will Charlie Ergen return fire?

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 4 Comments
  • SCS

    Office furniture manufacturer Steelcase (SCS -6.5%) falls hard after missing analysts' revenue...

    Office furniture manufacturer Steelcase (SCS -6.5%) falls hard after missing analysts' revenue estimates for Q1. The company blamed "timing of shipment updates" and slow sales in France and Northern Europe for the top line shortfall. Despite the miss, CEO James Hackett says he is "not too concerned … as order growth in the Americas was better than expected." Nevertheless, the company forecast Q2 EPS of $0.22-0.26, below consensus of $0.27/share. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • UNS

    UNS Energy (UNS -5.1%) slips after Jefferies downgrades the shares to Hold and cuts its price...

    UNS Energy (UNS -5.1%) slips after Jefferies downgrades the shares to Hold and cuts its price target from $57 to $49.50. The firm cites regulatory uncertainty introduced by the ACC review of retail competition. If the ACC adopts retail competition, future earnings of Arizona regulated electric companies will depend on commodity prices for gas and power, the length of the transition period and the regulatory treatment of stranded cost. Jefferies recommends investors move to the sideline until the issues are resolved.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • EBIX

    Ebix (EBIX -42.7%) has crashed to levels last seen in May 2010 after announcing its M&A deal...

    Ebix (EBIX -42.7%) has crashed to levels last seen in May 2010 after announcing its M&A deal with Goldman is off thanks to a U.S. Attorney investigation. Though Ebix says it will keep evaluating "strategic options," investors are betting the company's accounting woes will make would-be buyers think twice and/or offer a much lower bid than Goldman's $20/share. "In my experience uncovering and dealing with some of the great software frauds in the past, Ebix could rise to that level," says short-seller Marc Cohodes, who helped uncover accounting frauds at CA and Lernout & Hauspie.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • FBIO

    Coronado Biosciences (CNDO -9.1%) takes another hard hit today, marking the the third straight...

    Coronado Biosciences (CNDO -9.1%) takes another hard hit today, marking the the third straight session of declines and racking up a 20% loss in the process. Wedbush is defending the shares, saying the weakness represents a buying opportunity. Data for TSO in Crohn's is due out in H213, and is likely to be positive. On that catalyst alone the firm sees significant upside potential from current levels. Additionally, positive data in Crohn’s means the Street is also likely value TSO in additional indications including MS, psoriasis and autism.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • FITB

    Not participating in the regional bank stock rally (yes rally) today are Fifth Third (FITB...

    Not participating in the regional bank stock rally (yes rally) today are Fifth Third (FITB -1.3%) and Flagstar (FBC -3.5%). The two are among several tagged by FBR's Paul Miller two months ago as being over-reliant on strong mortgage origination results. BTIG's Mark Palmer takes issue, suggesting investors stop worrying about gain on sale, and instead focus on new management's proven talents at cutting costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • OTIV

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTIV +16%. LGND +14%. FNSR +12%. NYNY +10%. ZN +9%. NVGN +8%. CEDU +8%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTIV +16%. LGND +14%. FNSR +12%. NYNY +10%. ZN +9%. NVGN +8%. CEDU +8%. CLSN +7%. COGO +7%. GME +7%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: EBIX -41%. FLO -35%. RIOM -16%. DQ -14%. ORMP -13%. PVG -11%. FCEL -11%. SVLC -11%. CLFD -10%. PGNX -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • USB

    Mostly in the green along with the life insurers today is much of the regional banking sector...

    Mostly in the green along with the life insurers today is much of the regional banking sector (KRE +0.5%) as a steeper yield curve is sure to boost their barely visible net interest margins. U.S. Bancorp (USB +0.1%), Huntington (HBAN +2.2%), New York Community (NYCB -0.1%), Regions (RF +0.7%), BB&T (BBT +1.2%), PNC (PNC +0.7%), SunTrust (STI +0.7%), KeyCorp (KEY +1.5%), People's Untied (PBCT +1.3%), Zions (ZION +1.9%), Comerica (CMA +1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • USG

    USG (USG -4.5%) slips in tandem with a weak homebuiling sector today, but gets an added prod...

    USG (USG -4.5%) slips in tandem with a weak homebuiling sector today, but gets an added prod from Wedbush, who initiated the shares this morning with a Neutral rating and a price target of $28. The firm cites choppiness in the commercial construction market, and says that its valuation already reflects growth and margin expansion over the next two years.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • MHO

    Despite better Existing Home Sale numbers for May, homebuilder stocks are taking a hit amid...

    Despite better Existing Home Sale numbers for May, homebuilder stocks are taking a hit amid worries about the Fed tapering its stimulus program: M/I Homes (MHO -6%), PulteGroup (PHM -8.2%), Ryland (RYL -8.2%), Toll Brothers (TOL -5.4%), D.R. Horton (DHI -7.1%) and KB Home (KBH -6.1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 9 Comments
  • CLC

    Clarcor (CLC -5.5%) slips today after missing on its FQ2 report late yesterday, with its EPS...

    Clarcor (CLC -5.5%) slips today after missing on its FQ2 report late yesterday, with its EPS coming in at $0.66, $0.01 worse than the Street estimate of $0.67. Net earnings rose 0.4% as the filter- and-packaging company recorded modest revenue growth, but the company cut the top end of its FY13 per-share earnings range forecast by five cents, now expecting to earn between $2.45 and $2.55, which is below the Street consensus of $2.56.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • CXPO

    Crimson Exploration (CXPO -3.4%) announces its first Buda formation oil discovery at a gross...

    Crimson Exploration (CXPO -3.4%) announces its first Buda formation oil discovery at a gross initial production rate of 859 boe/day and a 30-day rate of 797 boe/day. The well is located in CXPO's Booth-Tortuga Area, where the company has ~10,140 gross acres prospective for the Buda formation.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -1.1%) dip to their lowest level in a month with the company's...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -1.1%) dip to their lowest level in a month with the company's FQ4 earnings report looming larger. Barclays isn't expecting a turnaround, forecasting B&N's comparable store sales at retail outlets lost ~10% during the quarter and weak Nook sales. Investors waiting for the Microsoft Hail Mary may have to ride out a few more bumps.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • PCMI

    Shares of PCM (PCMI +0.2%) are higher as positive news for GameStop on the used game business...

    Shares of PCM (PCMI +0.2%) are higher as positive news for GameStop on the used game business spills over to help sentiment on the company formerly known as PC Mall. Though the two retailers have much different business models, they are still hanging on as brick-and-mortar survivors.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • BLK

    BlackRock's (BLK -6.1%) stock takes no comfort from Stifel Nicolaus bumping its price target to...

    BlackRock's (BLK -6.1%) stock takes no comfort from Stifel Nicolaus bumping its price target to $286 from $265, noting an improved outlook for earnings following a meeting with management. ETF outflows in May and June are being offset by market share gains and better margins, says Stifel.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • LGND

    Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND +3.7%) says its board has agreed to waive certain poison pill...

    Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND +3.7%) says its board has agreed to waive certain poison pill provisions to allow BVF Partners, its largest shareholder, to increase its ownership limit from 19.99% up to 24.99%. BVF currently has a 17.7% stake in the company. The waiver comes with provisions however, including a nine month window to purchase the shares, certain voting restrictions, a minimum hold period, and BVF's guarantee it won't attempt to nominate any directors to the board.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • NSM

    Previously high-flying specialty mortgage servicers get punished though higher interest rates...

    Previously high-flying specialty mortgage servicers get punished though higher interest rates would seemingly eliminate prepayment risk for their portfolios. Nationstar (NSM -5.1%), Ocwen (OCN -3.4%), Walter Investment (WAC -5%), New Residential (NRZ -1.2%)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL -12.8%) takes a hit today after pricing its $38M senior convertible note...

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL -12.8%) takes a hit today after pricing its $38M senior convertible note offering of 8.00% senior unsecured convertible notes due June 15, 2018. The notes are convertible at a conversion rate of 645.1613 shares per $1,000 note, equivalent to a conversion price of $1.55 per share on the common stock. Net proceeds should be around $36M, for which the company plans to use for working capital and general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • NAV

    Shares of Navistar (NAV -7.6%) are having a rough day after the company recalls over 7K trucks...

    Shares of Navistar (NAV -7.6%) are having a rough day after the company recalls over 7K trucks which might have a braking issue. The bigger story behind Navistar is its financial condition. Last week, S&P had its say by downgrading the firm's credit rating to B- from B and maintaining a negative outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • CMO

    With mortgage REITs (REM -1.7%) tumbling again, KBW looks at where a floor might be found. As a...

    With mortgage REITs (REM -1.7%) tumbling again, KBW looks at where a floor might be found. As a whole, the group is trading at an "unusually large" discount to book value in the teen percentages, but there's no reason to believe it can't go to 20%. While "gravity tends to pull it back toward zero," history has proven these discounts can pervade for a long time. Not surprisingly, those mREITs that have managed through a full cycle before sport the lowest yields and discounts: Capstead (CMO -1.2%), Hatteras (HTS -0.5%), Anworth (ANH -1.1%), Dynex (DX -1.4%). Annaly (NLY -1%) may not make this list because of the passing of Mike Farrell.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • TUR

    Turkish equities (TUR -5.6%), already hampered by weeks of political tension (I, II, III), slide...

    Turkish equities (TUR -5.6%), already hampered by weeks of political tension (I, II, III), slide markedly as a global sell-off makes an already tenuous situation worse for the Borsa Istanbul, which falls 6.15% to 73,984 — that's nearly 20K points in the wrong direction from levels hit post-Moody's upgrade (I, II) in May.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • NEM

    On a disastrous day for mining stocks, Newmont Mining (NEM -4.2%) also is downgraded to Market...

    On a disastrous day for mining stocks, Newmont Mining (NEM -4.2%) also is downgraded to Market Perform at Cowen. It's not a stinging rebuke, as the firm sees shares as fully valued while remaining positive on NEM's prospects and ability to pay dividends. But it's enough to send NEM to fresh 52-week lows, along with: AUY -7.1%, ABX -6.5%, ANV -6.3%, GG -5.6%, SLW -5.5%, GOLD -5.1%, EGO -5%, VALE -4.7%, RIO -4.6%, BHP -3.6%, AU -3.3%, GFI -3.3%, PAAS -2.5%, HMY -1.9%, BVN -1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 6 Comments
  • ITMN

    InterMune (ITMN -2.6%) slips this morning after filing a mixed shelf registration to sell, from...

    InterMune (ITMN -2.6%) slips this morning after filing a mixed shelf registration to sell, from time to time, up to $300M in Common Stock, Preferred Stock, Debt Securities, Warrants, or any combination thereof.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +3.1%) is rising on a down day, as upgrades from UBS (Neutral) and...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +3.1%) is rising on a down day, as upgrades from UBS (Neutral) and BofA/Merrill (Buy) overshadow a downgrade from BNP Paribas (Underperform). Shares are up 6% since CEO Michel Combes unveiled his Shift Plan. Light Reading points out the plan is still missing some key details, such as which assets Alcatel plans to sell and how many jobs will be cut. The site also notes "IP networking," one of Combes' two focus areas, covers not only routers, but also optical networking gear, cloud and network software, and consulting/integration services. Alcatel is targeting 2015 revenue of €7B and an op. margin of 12.5% for IP networking, up from 2012's €6.1B and 2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • SODA

    SodaStream (SODA +0.9%) trades higher despite being downgraded by William Blair to Market...

    SodaStream (SODA +0.9%) trades higher despite being downgraded by William Blair to Market Perform from Outperform. The fundamental side of the argument on SodaStream focuses on the higher penetration rates the company could see in the U.S., but traders are warning that in the short term short selling/squeezes could dominate the action.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • MFC

    What's outperforming this morning? Life insurers for one, with Manulife (MFC +2%) leading the...

    What's outperforming this morning? Life insurers for one, with Manulife (MFC +2%) leading the way after an upgrade. These companies have a near-impossible time of meeting their investment bogies with long-term yields so low, so the 10-year close to 2.5% works better than 2.2% a day ago and 1.7% weeks ago. MetLife (MET +1.1%), Prudential (PRU -0.1%), Hartford (HIG unchanged), Sun Life (SLF +0.8%), Lincoln National (LNC +0.1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • GME

    Shares of GameStop (GME +3.9%) stay elevated and carve out a 52-week high after yesterday's news...

    Shares of GameStop (GME +3.9%) stay elevated and carve out a 52-week high after yesterday's news that Microsoft will walk back used game restrictions boosts sentiment. What Microsoft called "candid feedback" from gamers more closely resembled a loud roar of disapproval from the gaming community. The final word from MSFT: "Trade-in, lend, resell, gift, and rent disc based games just like you do today."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • SDRL

    Seadrill (SDRL -2.4%) orders an additional pair of high specification jack-up drilling rigs at...

    Seadrill (SDRL -2.4%) orders an additional pair of high specification jack-up drilling rigs at ~$230M each, as it looks to capitalize on the need to renew the world’s aging jack-up fleet. The latest newbuilds bring to eight the number of jack-ups SDRL has on order from China’s Dalian Shipbuilding, with deliveries due over the next three years, and will increase its jack-up fleet to 29 units.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 5 Comments
  • ASTI

    Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI +11.4%) opens higher after announcing Energizer has chosen Ascent to be...

    Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI +11.4%) opens higher after announcing Energizer has chosen Ascent to be its solar panel provider for a project aiming to donate rechargeable LED lanterns and area lights to families in developing nations.Ascent declares its CIGS panel tech is well-suited for lights operating in extreme conditions. Shares rallied on Tuesday thanks to a deal to sell preferred shares/warrants to an unnamed private investor. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • DDD

    3D Systems (NYSE:DDD) -2% and ExOne (NASDAQ:XONE) -1.5%, following markets lower, after...

    3D Systems (NYSE:DDD) -2% and ExOne (NASDAQ:XONE) -1.5%, following markets lower, after Stratasys (NASDAQ:SSYS) announces it's buying desktop 3D printer vendor MakerBot, which competes against 3D's Cube line. Sources tell Kara Swisher MakerBot is on track to post 2013 revenue of $75M+, up ~5x from 2012's $15.7M (Q1 sales were $11.5M). VentureBeat points out Stratasys' cheapest 3D printer (the Mojo) currently goes for ~$10K, whereas MakerBot's Replicator 2 goes for $2.2K. 3D Systems has hinted Cube pricing could eventually go well below $1K. SSYS +1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM

  • Market preview: "Roll up, roll up, everything must go." Except for the U.S. dollar, which seems...

    Market preview: "Roll up, roll up, everything must go." Except for the U.S. dollar, which seems to be about the only thing rising after Ben Bernanke signaled that he could soon start dialing down the money printing presses. U.S. stock futures are getting off relatively lightly compared with some of the carnage elsewhere - gold is -5.8% - with the S&P Mini only -0.9%, although that is on top of a 1.4% drop for the S&P 500 in regular trading yesterday. Later: Existing Home Sales, Philly Fed Business Outlook, Leading Indicators
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • EMKR

    Emcore (NASDAQ:EMKR) +6.1% premarket on news of a solar cell assembly supply contract with...

    Emcore (NASDAQ:EMKR) +6.1% premarket on news of a solar cell assembly supply contract with India's space research organization to manufacture, test and deliver high-efficiency multi-junction solar cell assemblies for commercial geostationary telecommunications and scientific earth observation satellite missions. The contract award is valued at $22M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • CLSN

    Celsion (NASDAQ:CLSN) is out with some upbeat ThermoDox commentary, saying the HEAT study's lead...

    Celsion (NASDAQ:CLSN) is out with some upbeat ThermoDox commentary, saying the HEAT study's lead European principal investigator Riccardo Lencioni has made two presentations discussing what he says are "post-hoc data that indicate ThermoDox may provide potential for clinically relevant improved progression free survival (NYSE:PFS) and Overall Survival (OS) outcomes." Shares +14.75% premarket. (Previous: SA contributor spars with CLSN over HEAT study)
